isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - HIGH PRESSURE OIL PUMP AND DRIVE GEAR (I-6 ELECT.), REPLACE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: HIGH PRESSURE OIL PUMP AND DRIVE GEAR (I-6 ELECT.), REPLACE
wtsproc.config: New computer design, mounted on left side of engine

step1.para: Chock wheels. Open hood.
Disconnect battery.
Disconnect both wire harness connections at computer.
Remove computer from support bracket.
Remove charge air cooler outlet pipe for access to computer support bracket. Disconnect air compressor hose at charge air pipe.
Disconnect wire harness for access to nuts retaining computer support bracket.
Remove computer support bracket.
Disconnect E.O.T. sensor, I.P.R. and low air pressure switch.
Remove E.O.T. sensor and syphon engine oil from cavity.
Remove fuel lines at transfer pump and fuel filter assembly. Cap ends.
Remove transfer pump and gasket.
Remove high pressure oil line from pump and oil rail. Cap ends.
Remove I.P.R. from high pressure oil pump.
Remove high pressure oil pump and gasket.
Clean mating surfaces.
Install high pressure oil pump and gasket. Torque to specification.
Install I.P.R. and torque nut to specification.
Install high pressure oil line.
Install fuel transfer pump. Torque bolts to specification.
Install fuel lines.
Install E.O.T. sensor.
Connect E.O.T. sensor, I.P.R. and low air pressure switch.
Install computer support bracket.
Connect wire harness.
Install charge air cooler pipe. Connect air compressor hose to pipe.
Install computer to support bracket.
Connect both wire harness connections to computer.
Connect battery.
Start engine, check operation and check for leaks.
Close hood and remove wheel chocks.
